name: kyle rubley
text: Been down here 3 times trying to pay a ticket and they always closed almost 9 am and they still closed

name: David Goodwin
text: Hear knothing good about there usually same stuff that's been said an being said for the last 30 years , town hall ,fire department pretty much the same , church next door is gigantic owns good chunk of the land around an continues to progress while everything else degrades it should pay taxes because it is run like a business well honestly it is a business ...

name: Pillsbury Dough Hoe
text: I had a traffic ticket. I attended court on september 13th. The judge in municipal court really cared about informing people of their rights and options. He was thorough, respectful, and kind. I later paid my fees over the phone, even though the directions said I would have to come in. The lady who took my payment was very kind and respectful. Call was answered on the first call. (That hardly ever happens anywhere else.)

name: Carrie Rutledge
text: Treated very condescendingly by the chief when asking for a police report. Needed help badly and was asked to leave and walking out, the step down sign I did not see if there was one, no one asked me to watch my step so with the chief behind me I fell to the ground, crying which sprained my ankle and tore ligaments, the women in office said nothing, I was humiliated, and accused of being intoxicated. Laughing at me, I left broken.

name: D Shan
text: THEY NEVER ANSWER THE PHONE!!!

name: Ariston Griffin
text: Great leadership.Willing to help any way possible.Awesome peoplw.

name: Brandon Vo
text: Not much people working over there but they give %100

name: Shannon Dean
text: It's a nice, quiet place for lunch or to have a get together.  The grounds aren't kept up as well as they were in the 80s but, it isn't terrible.  The ponds really need work though.

name: Katrina Hurd
text: Beautiful area to walk around.

name: SHANIYAH HERRON
text: Buddy Watson park

name: Roland Vance
text: Fantastic organization with fantastic demeanor! Service technician addressed my washer when no one else could or would.

name: Roland Vance
text: revouyt

name: Ginger Gilmore
text: Seems to be out of the office an awlful lot...unless he is doing a press conference, but then no one else has a right to THEIR opinion! Amazing what a pitiful mayor and police chief Birmingham AL has.

name: James Lawley
text: This city is quickly becoming a suburb of Hoover due to the lack of leadership and ignorance of those in charge.

name: Art Of Valor
text: Friendly and helpful folks who work here.

name: Brenda Lee Young
text: Everyone I come into contact with was very nice, polite and offered to help in any way possible.

name: Bryan Roberts
text: They were very gentle when they handcuffed me, and there patrol cars are incredibly roomy. Overall, very professional. I will definitely be getting arrested by them again. 😀

name: Brady Galloway
text: Great guys! Love when they talk to the school!

name: Tiffiny Smith
text: You guys will never know how grateful I am to you for helping out my son as he was driving thru on his way to Panama City Beach. Officer Karr you are my hero.  I respect each and every one of you. Thank you from the bottom of my heart!

name: Dannion Cicero
text: Some of Prattville's Finest

name: audrey haskin
text: Visited the Livingston City Council meeting. Small town flavor. Gotta luv it

name: Tasha Whitworth
text: Came too see my niece play softball!!! She got her one!!!! Home run baby and I got the ball....

name: Ann Riley
text: Great place to watch baseball! Very nice facilities.

name: Martin&Susanne Sweet
text: Nice ball park. Grounds are well kept. Clean bathrooms. The parking area isn't lit so it's a bit intimidating to walk through at night; walk in groups.

name: David Driver
text: Great very nice and clean

name: Angel Franklin
text: nice ball park

name: shelby jernigan
text: Was a really good place was not dirty at all.

name: Anthony Evans
text: WAKA Kickball is a blast!

name: Jada J.
text: This is perfect

name: Juliana Maison
text: Wonderful staff! The two ladies up front (Michelle and Amber maybe?) were so helpful, completely going above and beyond. Brian also made sure that all of my questions were answered thoroughly. I had to have multiple inspections, and I was worried when I couldn't get the same inspector twice, but they were both phenomenal. That office is a well oiled machine.

name: Jonathan Calderon
text: Friendly government staff.

name: Christian Dawson
text: Great group of hard working men

name: Justin Ragsdale
text: I believe the customer service at every level of this place form the front desk to the inspectors to the management that oversee the whole operation could be improved drastically. No one wants to help you in any way and want to make moving forward as big a burden as possible. The city definitely could use some additional oversight in these offices I am sure of that.

name: susie adams
text:
We worked with a very difficult property and were encouraged
and educated during that process.  A big shout out to
Brandon Miller for all the help he gave along the way

name: Gwen Bergeron
text:
My 3 adult daughters & I came to Orange Beach & stayed at the Phoenix  X for Labor weekend. The condo was fabulous, the beach was clean, the water was beautiful. We arrived late Fri. evening. Sat. we went out &purchased 4 beach chairs,2 umbrellas & ancors. We hauled it all back to the room that evening.  Sun. morning noticed that everyone left there's on the beach(Sat evening) that Sun. afternoon we left those items on the beach, planning to go pick them up after dinner. We returned between 8:30 & 9pm and went to pick up our things.We were told the city cleans up the beach & they throw everything. We were not advised about that when we checked in. The sign @the desk was at the end of the counter & there was something obstructing our view from where we stood. There were no signs on the way to the beach nor in the elevators stating that. The least the clean up crew could have done is  put the brand new chairs & umbrellas in lost & found. Needless to say that sure ruined a good weeken & lost $150.00 of beach necessities. I think between the town & The Phoenix X we should get reimbursed.  I certainly could not afford to lose that amount of money. Sorry to everyone that my rant wa so long.
Gwen B. from Louisiana.

name: Eric Daily
text: I love these people!

name: Craig Winn
text: City hall is three buildings in one. It has bikes for the trails and the council chambers. Great facilities.

name: Warren Behling
text: Public safety was attentive

name: P A Pennington
text: Rude. Not helpful.

name: Glenn Snow
text: Good customer service. Easy to get what you need to start buisness in Northport.

name: Bobby Hamilton
text: Everything you need is there.

name: Melissa Ohlrich
text: The staff really need to be put in here and let the inmates loose on them. They are the worst people I've ever encountered  (as a visitor).

name: Anthony Cornelius
text: Their five star service won't leave you disappointed. The many amenities that are offered is astounding. From the Olympic size pool, luxury spa, to free WIFI it can't be beat. Don't forget to try the room service.

name: Nan Messer
text: Haven't been there yet.  My son is there  : /  But after a year of my Son being incarcerated at Limestone Correctional Facility, WOW 😥😨😰 The prisoners, I feel are treated so inhumanly ! The Food, if that's what they call it !

name: Jt Lyncharts
text: The staff failed to ressucitate an inmate after a heart attack, state is trying to hide it. Their staff and warden deserve to sit behind the bars they work.

name: Jamie Contreras
text: My husband is there and he has witness 5 stabings and seen someone OD right in front of him and there Staff did nothing he said there’s so many drugs in there it’s crazy terrible run place worse place you’d wanna end up

name: Nitro Sims
text: It is not fun to live there...

name: manuel conde
text: Great staff at the Sanitation department. Came after Huracane Zeta and picked up everything with a smile. Great Job, great service to the tax payer.

name: Catherine Campbell
text: The City Hall staff were very helpful in solving my issues with the trash pickup. Very friendly. I also would like to thank the officer who stopped and assisted me. Thank you

name: Josh Baltimore
text: One of the racist City in Alabama the police will pull you over just for anything then they get smart with you every time you go to the courthouse rather stay in Hoover ! They gave me a ticket because I was rushing toy fiance aide and my kids when she was in a car wreck

name: Google Mapper
text:
Pleasantly surprised. The City Hall staff were nice, friendly, and helpful. Plus, the facility was beautiful. Although, not as beautiful as the Court Clerk! They require a face mask and social distancing is well planned and posted. I was expecting more of the urban "city worker" attitude and hearing numerous phones ringing in the background that go unattended. You know, where one clerk window is open with 20+ people in line. While four other windows are closed because those clerks ate watching TikTok on their phone. You've been there before. Not in New Hope Alabama. New Hope City Hall is professional and proficient. They are what all other city buildings in this country should strive to be!!!! Well done and a special thanks to the Sheriff's office for helping as well. Experience = memorable.
( **No, I have never been there before, don't know anyone who works there, not a resident, and not getting paid to write this post!!)

name: Connie bennett
text: Wasn't busy and very helpful

name: Mr. Walker
text: The longest and most arduous court proceedings ever.... I've been in here 2.5hrs for a traffic ticket and it's 25 people in here.  Long winded for no reason.

name: Remonia McCullars
text: Very good

name: Harold Taylor
text: service was excellent

name: M.J. Barnard
text: It was okay, I was there to visit my sister-in-law.

name: Jenny Mclester
text: The staff at Town Hall is so helpful .  They answer every question I have.  I very much appreciate them.

name: Vicki Jenkins
text: Easy place to get to and drop off recycles.

name: marshae davis
text: My girls took the preschool and 5 yr old gymnastics class and love it . They will be back in the fall

name: Carminita Wilson
text: My daughter loves attending tumbling. The teachers are very knowledgeable.

name: Constance James
text: My son learned his famous back flip. Love cottage hill gymnastic.

name: Sarah Curbow
text: The Strawberry Festival was fun it did not have a great variety of jams and produce like I was expecting but the strawberries were fantastic and they had big blow ups for the kids that were free which was nice I absolutely recommend it for a nice afternoon out and just to get out and explore the booths

name: Rona Goodwin
text: Went specially for home grown tomatoes and there were several farmers still there with the most delicious tomatoes !

name: Opa Racletos
text: This farmers’ market is incredible. From freshly picked ( and locally grown) produce, or handcrafted arts and crafts items you won’t be disappointed in your decision to stop and shop at Festhalle. And, the post and beam designed building is a fantastic piece of architecture to explore. Enjoy Cullman!

name: Rachel Dawsey
text: I love the Cullman Festhalle Market!  I love the ease of getting fresh produce on Tuesdays, Thursdays, or Saturdays.  It is a beautiful market- the largest timber-frame building in Alabama.

name: Emily Anne Jones
text: What is there is nice and friendly. We always enjoy going, hope it will grow over time!

name: Christy Winfrey
text: Lovely setup, wish there would have been more vendors. More soaps and candles than food items.

name: dorrian johnson
text: Great community excellent people and great service !

name: Danny Niblett
text: Nice people

name: Raymond Dake
text: Nice place

name: Teresa Jackson
text: Scout meeting

name: jim howard.
text: Came here over the weekend to help with their cat population, and decided to adopt one the following Monday. The adoption process was very easy, and right off the bat, I could tell how much the ladies here care for these animals. This would be a very tough job in my humble opinion, but the ladies were very kind, genuine, and was so thankful for me and my family taking home a pet. These ladies do amazing work here, and I am truly thankful for the difference they’ve made for these animals, and the people willing to adopt.

name: Haley Elise
text: They’re always “out of animals” and they’ve been saying that since may. They probably just don’t want to do their job. I wish I could give 0 starts,I feel so bad for the animals in this shelter.

name: Jacob Roberts
text: Anyone who discredits this place is in the wrong. They do care for the animals and are a low kill shelter. They are small yes, but that doesn't mean they should have funding pulled or lose their jobs. Most issues arise out of people being too stupid to realize that you have to have proof you live in Saraland to submit an animal to the shelter. Adopting is easy. If the workers personalities aren't to your liking, go spend 8 hours in the kennels.

name: Courtney Rainwater
text: If I could give 0 stars I would!!!! The workers here are extremely rude and negligent, trying to get anything done is a nightmare.  I feel bad for these poor animals.

name: Tonya Kelly
text: Saraland animal shelter does not care for any animals. They are cruel especially the lady in the office. I wouldnt recommend any body to visit this place. When i asked for her supervisor she wouldnt give me her name or number. I have also reported them to the BBB

name: Burchfield lc
text: This place could care less about animals. City funding should be pulled.

name: Ella Stuart
text: I don’t know

name: Bk Bk
text: Went in for a tag renewal there was no one in liine and we went strait up to the window. Unfortunately we have to go to another county to get it renewed

name: chris walker
text: Friendly, efficient and fast. I dont think I have ever said this about a municipality but they are good at their job even with covid-19 in place. Went in and received my tag information in about 10 mind maybe 15 tops.

name: Matt Cobb
text: Decent sized venue that is well maintained.

name: Blakely Farm (Wargolem)
text: Mayor got trolled by 4chan.  Any idiot can do a quick Google search and confirm that "the okay sign" is not a racist symbol.  Normally when it is upside down it means "if you look at this I can punch you" a game that kids play in elementary school.  #pwned

name: BakaFett 1775
text:
The SJW Mayor suspended 4 Police Officers without pay for two weeks
for making a hand a hand gesture in a photo that is a widely accepted and understood to be part of a "kids game" where you get to hit someone in the nuts if you can get them to look at your fingers making a circle as long as it is below your waist. I learned about the game in the Army from a Black Soldier... This game has been around YEARS and has NEVER been used for white power. The white power thing was literally started as a troll by a Troll Site called 4Chan. This only shows how ignorant the Mayor is.

name: Douglas Farkas
text: Trashy mayor

name: Anthony Pent
text: Have come asap even on weekends.   Don and Jeff are 2 of the hardest working people who actually give a darn.   If you have a problem with either... its you, not them!

name: Mandie Greene
text: The automatic system does not work. It was so much more convenient with the old system- never had a problem. Every month, same problem. Get equipment that works properly

name: Chad Joiner
text: Today I had a great experience dealing with Auburn Utilities. I had questions about my garbage pick up. I spoke with Pam, a customer service representative, she was very kind and helpful. It’s always good doing business with professionals. Thanks Pam and the City of Auburn.

name: Dustin Maines
text: Always have outstanding customer service but when it comes to the payment ever since this new update it has been horrible can make a payment online unless you owe something first and I always put a credit on my account so start sending checks and it take over a week or more for anything to come threw dont understand why it takes so long to post money to the account I really hate the new payment service and wish they would put it back to where it was. Word of advice if it is not broke dont fix it

name: Ashley Couch
text:
This company provides a good service, but does not hesitate to fine you if you are even one day late on your payment. The fine is $5, unless you continue to be late and then your service is cut off, entailing more fines. $5 is almost 10% of my bill (usually), so it seems like an inappropriately high amount for a required service. I have not been able to figure out how to set up auto-pay on my account online, despite having all my other bills set to auto-pay and looking for the option many times. You also can't set up a payment through the online account with your bank online - it is card only. That makes it very inconvenient for a lot of people that do not have cards (mostly poor people, minorities, people who don't have good credit, etc) or do not want to use cards.

In my opinion it seems like the company wants to fine people since it makes it inconvenient in many ways to pay your bill and only allows for 14 - 15 days to make your payment.

I can fully understand that companies need to pay for their expenses and empathize with the fact that these services cost money, but it would be much better if there was more time allowed to make the payment or if auto-pay or bill pay setup on the water works website through your bank was possible. With this being the only water service provider in the Auburn area, to me it is very unfair since I have NO choice in the matter. I fail to see how this is not exactly like a monopoly which is supposed to be illegal in this country.

I have been fined at least 3 times in the last 6 months alone because I forgot to pay my bill in that short window of time and can't figure out how to set up auto-pay. That is very frustrating and if there was any other option for these services I would change in a h e a r t b e a t !

name: Patrick Arthurs
text: Needed a replacement garbage can. Called and they delivered a new one in 2 hours. Great service from the environmental service team.

name: Michael
text: I honestly think I've paid more fines than towards my actual utility use, that's probably an exaggeration, but seriously they will fine you and you'll feel like they could have given you some more time. the fine has literally been over 100% of my bill at times. No choice, like the other person said. they will remove 1 $50 late payment thought, again once only.

name: Austin Coulter
text: I would love to give 0 stars but it isn't available. This company fluctuates my bill amount every month, yet they say everything is a flat rate for services. They are only open until 4:30 every day and most of the time close before that time. For those who actually work until 5 every day can never make it on time. Several times I have left work early to take my payment there by 4:30 and they are already closed, forcing a $50 "reconnect" fee that is almost double my actual bill, in which no reconnection service is ever performed. This is a terrible company and a terrible way to run a business. Most people I talk to about this company feel the exact same way.

name: Clay Knight
text: Customer service reps on the phone have been super helpful and kind! Shoutout to Tucker!

name: Danielle Mitchell
text: I don't like the fact I can't make arrangments online. I have had my water cut off multiple times for being a day late after calling and one person telling me my bill is due on a certain day every month then come to find out its different almost every month which is hard to keep up with on top of everything else and having 3 kids. They will charge you 5$ and 50 to get it cut back on. Even if you've never been late and been with them for 3 years they don't hesitate to cut your water off. My bill is always a different amount and we don't use much water. Even got them to check for a leak because our bill was so high and we don't change our water habits often so there was no reason for it to be 20$ more.. The manager lady does try to help and has helped in the past, but they still have their issues.

name: Terry brooks
text: I would rate lower if possible but one star was the lowest I could go. This company seems to like to cheat people out of the $5 late fee every month. The due date for the bill is different every month unlike every other bill I pay. The due date last month was on 10/4 and this month it is 11/2. The payment system is one of the most out of date I have seen. I do not understand why the due day changes each month but I believe it’s on purpose to get an extra $5 outbof every customer.

name: Leah Prewitt
text: I fail to understand the logic behind not allowing automatic drafts if you have had two returned checks in the fifteen years you have had service with a utility.  Surely you are less likely to have irregular or late payments if you have fewer people on automatic draft.  In my own case, I am disabled and a senior, and my illness makes it difficult for me to remember things.  Having auto draft for almost all my bills is how I survive.  I had two months where through no fault of my own, an extra mortgage payment came out of my bank account.  And so, after fifteen years of paying exactly on time, they cut me off auto pay.  Now I have had two months where I have had to pay $5.00 in a late fee and $50.00 in a delinquent fee-whatever the difference is.  It doesn't even say on the bill when it is due, even though the web site refers to it.  This is just governmental stupidity.

name: carol carruth
text: I just recently went through a big medical procedure and am just now getting back to daily life. I received a notice stating that a $50 late fee would be added to my $51 water bill if it was not paid by 4:30 ON THE DUE DATE. This is shocking. I can pay this bill, but what if I had to wait due to a financial or medical crisis. The last thing someone who can't pay their $50 water bill needs is a "late fee" of $50. That is beyond usury.

name: Jeff G
text:
For such an insignificant utility service, this is the most tyrannical entity I have ever dealt with. The window of time to make a payment is extremely short (less than the month for which services are billed) and if you don't make the payment immediately on time, an automatic late fee kicks in. Do these people not realize they manage a college tow in which not only students are often gone for extended time, but so too are the faculty and staff who run this town?! What is their response to requesting an amendment of the late fee? They will only wave the late fee once per the LIFE of the account! Let me get this straight- if I live to be 100 years old (God help me if I am still living in Auburn), and they waved my late fee when I was 23, I will never have another late fee waved? What happens if you don't pay your late fee within 2 weeks? The add a "reconnect" fee that is ~$50. This fee is added even if they don't actually reconnect your services. So where did the $50 go? Who knows. Where have all of my $5 late fees gone? Who knows.
I hope every single person that has any degree of management in this terrible city service loses their job. They are meant to serve the citizens of Auburn. They are not doing their jobs.

name: seth Perry
text: At least they turn it on in a timely manner.

name: Charles Gwin
text: I paid my bill of 195 which is crazy but I did any way. And 12 hours after I paid the bill the water is off.. I work almost 90 hours every week and most of the time I'm not even in the state. So bring it is that I paid the bill and 12 hours later it's still off is why I'm pretty upset

name: Jackie Violenes-Walker
text: The lady who is at the left Cust service window is always nice to me and my son and always trying to find ways to help save on my water bill

name: Andrew Field
text: After depositing a $300 credit into my account because I am frequently out of the state or country I was promised my water would be turned back on the same day after it was turned off. I leave the country again tomorrow and my water has still not been turned on despite paying my bill and the fifty dollar fee. I imagine I will fit right in with the Europeans tomorrow because I will not have a shower. Thanks a lot Auburn Water Works. (Middle Finger Emoji)

name: Emma D
text: Honestly, cannot believe i'm writing a review of a water company in my free time but here we are...... anyway  they are the worst people i've ever dealt with truly

name: Philip Dugas
text: Technicians don't waste any time turning water off...  Customer service tries to help as much as possible.

name: Will Richardson
text: They ran a truck into my apartment destroying one of my walls and still charged me for my water bill.

name: Matt Parker
text: The absolute worst

name: jim stivender
text: Waited and waited to get a customer representative to  report that our re-cycle bin had not been picked up. Gave up after about 30 minutes. Also I tried to rate 0 stars and was not allowed to post!

name: James Martin
text: Only because 0 stars isn't a thing.

name: Tanner Hardy
text: Very unresponsive and unprofessional

name: Candi Upton
text: Our neighborhood recycling collectors are great. I just saw them pick up a small dog that had followed them down the street and return it home before moving on to their next street. Thank you for going above your job to care for our community’s pets!

name: Carl Holt
text: Non of the employees were wearing masks.

name: Tina Sprayberry
text: I am changing my review from one to five stars!  I talked to the manager, Mr. Anthony Sherman, and he had my issue resolved the same afternoon!!  You are appreciated Mr. Sherman!!

name: Jamin Carter
text: I had a problem where my garbage was not picked up from my driveway for 2 weeks in a row.  The first week i let go by but the second week i called to find out what the problem was.  They were very friendly but told me the policy in which we needed to work in order for my trash to be picked up on a day that wasn't my scheduled day.  I was pretty hacked off at his greater inconvenience but within a few minutes, Jennifer called my back and said she located a driver in the area and was routing him to my house to take care of the garbage.  They took a bummer situation and made it more than I expected.

name: Hadar_ben Yisrael
text: One of the Hardest working Department's in the City of Tuscaloosa...Great Leadership and Great Guy's dedicated to their Profession

name: Liz Singer
text: So happy to have glass and electronics recycling available so close to home.  My favorite event is hazardous waste day.

name: Marc M.
text: Always something interesting to see.

name: reed spacer
text: I love these people! They are very nice!

name: Frederick Hardy
text: ok blue sky green trees again west my new home trees from east to north to south west to west green i argue what if who get really green first to start cutting I see many like you here to begin cutting then leaves in the summer

name: Julie Dickey
text: This is a nice, large, clean picnic type area. I went in April 2017 for an Organ Donor family day to meet up with those who had received organs from my spouse who passed away while at UAB.

name: Mary Phillips
text: The food is good and the service.

name: Paulette Brown
text: Just a 2 and a half hour wait, but it was worth it, I also had my uncle with me so the company help pass the time.

name: Stacey Smith
text: Magic city classic had a great experience, this was my first time,the tailgate especially loved.although it was heavy rain pouring down the whole time making it unbearable to sit out and enjoy the game and bands

name: Vercingtorix Wilson
text: Nice place to sit and think

name: Alexandria Addy
text: Been going to this place since I was a kid. Very relaxing

name: Priscilla Harmon
text: Wonderful peace of mind

name: Eddie Spencer
text: Great location

name: Terry Jones
text: Great

text: Nice

text: Great place

name: Lovell Jones
text: Nice scenery

name: Charlene Davison
text: Its ok

name: Jason Shafer
text: Clean

name: BJ Little
text: Great

name: Calvin Edwards
text: Old but workable

name: Mehedi Hasan
text: Like this place.

name: Heather King
text: Very nice and Friendly

name: Lucas D'Antonio di Vito
text:
(Translated by Google) 💝😜 PRECIOUS

(Original)
💝😜 PRECIOSO

name: Ivy Evans
text: Nowhere near as beautiful as it once was but still a superb park for walking.

name: Brandan Bolton
text: Well maintained courts. Beautiful.

name: chris withers
text: Well maintained courts with lights and friendly courteous staff......Go check them out.....

name: Fredrick Halcomb
text: Fair.

name: Anthony Cornelius
text: Handsome looking building.  I've never had any dealings with the city though. I did deliver their huge artificial Christmas tree about two years ago though LOL. Merry Christmas Homewood!🎄🎅⛄❄🎄

name: adam ledbetter
text: Building is clean and cool. Be nice if just one of the four water fountains on the first floor worked...not a drop.

name: Timothy Johnson
text: Went to get my Business license here for my pest control company down the road. They were very polite and easy to work with!

name: Fatoumata Sow
text: I dont know any good from it because I never went there but I will on the 5th on January 15th

name: Mark Bolding
text: An excellent place to host a charity event.

name: Dawn Kilby
text: It took me a few minutes to process my transaction. User friendly.

name: Haley Wallace
text: Only cuz negative stars isn’t allowed …. Have to deal with Customer accounts manager then you’ll know!!!! Great except for her!

name: Janet Waddell
text: It's listed as being open todayUntil 4:30Just drove all the way up thereThey're closed for Good FridayI've not heard of anybody closing for Good Friday and 10 years

name: Billy Hatfield
text: Just stopped by here to get service transferred to my name after buying a house. I was in and out in 15 minutes. Carolyn was extremely friendly and helpful and was even able to give me a bill estimate based on previous usage at the address. Great service.

name: KATRISA FOSTER
text: Horrible experience! I reported a power outage and three hours later the whole neighborhood got power restored but my side of the street is still without power 13 hours later. How is this even possible? I seriously hate it here!

Customer service is outstanding.  Always a positive experience each time I call them.  So appreciative of all the ladies who answer the phone, and their online social media is excellent and informative as well.  Thanks!

name: Mary Marrone
text: Barbra burrell shouldn't work with customers 😬 she is pretty much a robot 😬 Be prepared to wait on hold forever and then when you finally reach someone they transfer you to a mail box 🤣

name: Cahil Quirk
text:
I have had  multiple accounts with Athens Utilities for over 24 years. The personnel at the account office have always been fantastic. They go out of their way to make the process easy and if the individual I am dealing with does not know the answer to my question they find someone that does.
Great Job, Thanks

name: Aubrie McFall
text: If it’s even supposed to storm, your power will go out and will be out for hours. They will never answer your calls, they have a voicemail system that makes it seem like they’ll answer, but they never will. I tried calling 5 times on repeat. There’s never any urgency to turn the power back on.

name: Zack Henry
text: Their power outage number isn't even connected and they only have one line so it stays busy. If this were a company and not a utility we depend on NO ONE would use them.

name: Zac Fleming
text: Athens utilities are crooks! They run the Christmas lights at courthouse from dark to sun up and spread the cost through out the community. My power more than doubled at my shop (storage building) where we don’t have heat that they claim has made my power go up. The lady on the ph said she understood but that’s what they told her to tell people who called in. The power and water will bend you over anyway they can.

name: Tessa Boxley
text: So tell me why when I got my lights turned on through Athens Utilities a year ago it was an easy process with no issues. I moved and came back to Athens and now I'm trying to get them cut back on. The employees are making this whole process a nightmare. They said since my boyfriend is on the lease with me they have to do a background check on his name and since he owes money from a past bill I can't get the lights on in my name! MY NAME. They absolutely didn't ask for this information a year ago and he was on the lease with me then too. I just want my lights on and more than willing to give them my money to do so but no they want to make everything a hassle.

name: James Nye
text: I understand we all have bad days especially if you work for the public. But not every who needs customer service is going to be a jerk so don't assume they will be. If you can at least be polite and not default to being rude, please do yourself a favor and find another job.

name: Pamela Hammond
text: Calling, holding for 25 minutes for the next representative and then getting disconnected. Don't bother calling. They just have to have a voice mail to look like they can help.

name: Shannon Fischer
text: They've changed their online payment system. And if you happen to be one of the old online payment folks you get an email telling you you need to update it. No letter. Nothing then you get this fancy HIGH bill saying they're going to cut your power off in 3 days. Just downright rude.

name: Richard & Peggy
text: I called them to have electric service connected during an ice storm. Then sent an email as instructed by customer service. The meter was in place and the power on before lunch. Very prompt, convenient, and courteous service. I did not have to get out on slick roads.

name: m
text: The worst service I've ever experienced. Honestly wish there was another option when it comes to utility providers. I had returned a phone call and requested a note be made on my account claiming that I could not pay till the end of the week. I was told it was no problem and the note had been made. They then proceeded to shut off my power a couple days later. When I called about it I was informed there was nothing they could do and that I HAD to pay my bill to turn it back on, even though they were at fault. This forced me to get ready for work in complete darkness. Both ladies I spoke with were EXTREMELY rude. I'm just thankful for the option to pay online so I don't have to worry about the rudeness and attitudes their employees seem to have an issue with and needs to be delt with

name: Fraser Golden
text: There was WIDESPRWAD power outage just 2 nights ago, Friday night, for almost 3 hours& it was a very muggy night which made it worse. Not a full 2 days have gone by and yet there is ANOTHER dam power outage!! And this is why I pay out the nose for utility service ??? Athens , get a dam clue on how to manage power to your customers!!! This is NOT a big city Therefore it's not that difficult to to MAINTAIN AMICABLE SERVICE!!!! I SWEAR. IF I HAD A CHOICEOF A DIFFERENT POWER COMPANY, I WILL GLADLY TAKE IT OVER THIS LITTLE PO DUNK CITY'S POWER ,OR RATHER, THE LACK THEREOF OF POWER!!

name: Sarah Capps
text: Leave it to the City of Athens to CHARGE your to pay your bill with out having to use a person. Hello McDonalds is going electronic ordering, and guess what THEY DON'T CHARGE YOUR FOR IT!!! Why because it saves them money, they don't have to hire people to take orders. Yup leave it to the City of Athens to be that stupid.

name: Nuke Life
text: Athens Utilities sucks the customer service it's breaking horrible. The charges here are insane and just plain out highway robbery. They charged me to turn my power on at my apartment that they were to incompetent to do. If I came to work and treated people they way they do then I would be fired. I can't wait until someone comes and buys them out or runs them out one. You suck!!!

name: Robin Whitt
text: The ladies that do the passport on the second floor are so nice and helpful!!

name: Nicholas Knowles
text: Athens Utilities is great and so is their customer service. Several weeks ago a street light on our street was damaged and after I brought it to the attention of Athens Utilities they came out and fixed it the next day, I was very impressed with that.

name: Brittney Jeffreys
text: The people that work there are so rude,  someone lied over the phone and said if I came in and paid my deposit before 1 pm that my power would be cut on and then I get there and it's a totally different story.  I have kids and am pregnant. So they expect me to sit in the heat.  I just moved here  and they're already leaving a bad taste in my mouth.

name: Steven Stark
text: They price gouge but you've gotta have them.

name: jenn renshaw
text: An amazing city! Hiking the Pinhoti Trail and the employees from city hall are super helpful.  They even came and pick us up from the trailhead and drove us into town so we could stay the night.

name: William Underwood
text: Nice and helpful personnel

name: Wade Dasingeru
text: Now the Trailhead of the Heflin Spur of the PInhoti Trail (3.5 miles to junction with the Pinhoti Trail at FS 500 Parking lot via Cahulga Creek Park. All blazed in white.

name: adam dasinger
text: Starting point of the Heflin Spur of the Pinhoti Trail. Information about the city is available here.

name: Angela House
text: We love the Parks and Rec system in Opelika! My children have participated in all kinds of sports and events!

name: Tricia Conn
text: Love this place! One of our favorite parks.Children and adults can get a little R&R in the great outdoors without leaving the city limits.

name: Southern Furniture Plus Tommy Carter
text: Outstanding!

name: Debbie Whitehead
text: Very friendly people love dience and love bothe the cops pete and Robert they are both sweet cops

name: C W
text: Very friendly and informative staff. Very helpful.

name: Emily B
text:
I've accepted the fact that no one is going to do anything about the Jones Vallery shopping mall. People can drive at 50mph on their phones, or blindfolded, because they're rich and entitled. I've stopped shopping here because of the insanity in the parking lot. No one yields to pedestrians, even those of us with children. Huntsville polive just let it happen, every single day.

Today my husband and I wanted to try the new Cajun restaurant in South Huntsville, the Salty Gator. This is another hub of human laziness and stupidity. Locals try to avoid using roadways and the construction traffic, so they drive like mental patients through Lowes/ Sam's Club/ Home Depot and the abandoned mall to Home Depot's right. A large white truck came inches away from me today. He blew through the first stop sign going into the Home Depot South Parkway parking lot, drove diagonally through the lot at about 65 mph, and blew the stop sign facing the cajun restaurant. He came so close to hitting me I was shaking, and lost my appetite. My husband sat with me in the car for a few mintues before we drove home. Driving diagonally through this parking lot seems to be the greatest craze since iphones. People sped through here, one or two a minute, and turned so hard their cars screetched when cutting the corner.

The first complaint I put in about this issue was not long ago, and the Huntsville police said there was nothing they could do about it. I was shopping at Pet Depot when an old blonde woman in a large black truck (license plate GUN 1) did not stop for my daughter and I as we were ALREADY CROSSING THE STREET. She was on her cell phone and did not notice us.

Why do you allow this to happen? Someone said the speed bumps had recently been paved. But its to no avail; its the rednecks and the large-truck drivers or construction trucks that swerve diagonally through this lot to avoid speed bumps, traffic and general roadways. Why do you allow this to happen so often? Why? Do you not realize people are terrified of this parking lot becuase of the obverse traffic flow? What is going on here?

These are major problems for pedestrians. No one is stopping it. I've been extremely dissapointed with the Huntsville police and local government time and time again. Your construction efforts have landed the same group of hard-working people in hours and hours of traffric, day after day, and no one is protecting pedestrians in the most seemingly innocent of environemnts.

name: Robyn R
text: Regarding the case with Tyler Truitt,  they claim his home is unsafe because he's not paying the city utilities, by using solar panels. Well all residents in that city who use solar panels need to be given the same notice and required to live elsewhere also. Or is it really because someone wants his property for a building development ?  Bet if a search was done on the surrounding property I would be right, and that owner probably bribed the Judge to turn down Tyler's appeal.  This country isn't a Republic or Democracy, it's a dictatorship!!!

name: Brian Orr
text: A great place to live :) Fairly decent-sized city, a good amount of different cultures, some great restaurants, and quite a few job opportunities in many different industries. Located along the Gulf Coast, nearby Pensacola, Florida, Pascagoula, Mississippi, and a decent drive away from New Orleans, Louisiana which is the closest major airport.

name: Robert Villarreal
text: Great Awsome The Best

name: Joe Kilpatrick
text: Quite a well run city

name: Christopher Calvin Reid
text: As a practicing attorney I have been to dozens of municipal courts in Alabama and I can say with absolute confidence that Auburn is one of the best run courts in this state. Its efficiently run, the clerks are excellent, the prosecutors are some of the most talented attorneys I know and in all my dealing with this court, they have always been fair. They actually care about improving the lives of the people who they deal with and that makes a huge difference. Christopher Calvin Reid

name: Brooke Boyd
text: Candice Jackson is awesome!

name: Katherine Holmes
text: Brett is AWESOME!! Just thought you guys would like to know!!

name: Quavardis Morrell
text: The Best JUDGE BY FAR!!! He will work with you and give you a fair shot, he and his staff are very well trained and are willing to help the people. If I was a resident of Jemison I would vote for him every year! He is nice but not Naive be straight up and he will be as well, You will be held accountable but fairly and if you take care of business and do the right thing he helps you!

name: Colby Lane
text: Great city government office, great service.

name: Doom Sucker
text: Georgiana has a lot of history including Hank Williams, the railroad, and the old buildings. It’s not great but I love it so much.

name: Michael Johnson
text: Charging fees to pay online in year 2020 is crazy.  I understand you are charged a fee by credit card companies and are passing it on, but why not let us pay direct from a checking account.  Very simple stuff.

name: Michael Floyd
text: I tried to go online and pay my property taxes on the last day and the website was down now its going to have late fee because the site was not up. Smh...whats the use in offering online bill pay if you can't pay it online when you need too?

name: Kenneth Zhang
text:
Have been here multiple times, line can get long at times but which tag office doesn’t? Five stars for the customer service. Very professional, courteous and helpful.

Every time I’ve been here I’ve been helped by Ms. Hemmings and she never fails to assist.

name: Joshua Stevens
text: I thought the Lee County Commission worked for us, their constituents? I have been battling Spectrum to extend copper service for internet less than a mile to our area. I was told by them first step in getting a petition for service from neighbors is contact my commisioner. So a week ago I text Robert Ham, no response, so I emailed Robert and Bill English inquiring how I go about contacting them. Still no response. District 4 this is our commisioner and he apparently doesn't care about us! I thought Bill English would at least respond....disappointing.

name: Daniel S
text: Need to update your policy on vehicle tax exemption for military members on your website. Make sure to include that residents of the county are not given the exemption, only military from out of state. I certainly was not told this when I called and spoke with someone at the office. All military should be all military, don’t discriminate against land owners who already pay taxes there. On another note, there needs to be some customer service training ASAP. Public servants work for the people, not the other way around.

name: Allegra Zachery
text: Rude employees...one in particular, doesn’t listen, Talks down to customers and us just very unprofessional. If you’re having a rough day, try not to take it out on the citizens of Lee County who are just trying to comply with tag renewal laws. I wish I could submit a formal complaint. Does anyone know how?

name: Cameron
text: The lady that types the list of delinquent property taxes was very helpful, was able to answer all my questions, and also directed me in the right direction for questions she was unsure of. Awesome customer service skills.

name: Robin Holladay
text: Tag office, line moved along swiftly. Officers at the door were very courteous.

name: Margarette Woodard
text: Had to learn where to go to do what i needed with all of the renavashions but it is beautiful

name: Jake_MF_Lowe
text: Very helpful patient and knowledgeable

name: craig s
text: Never had an issue here. I feel like they bent over backwards to help me out each and every time I call or come in. I am from Maryland, so I am not used to this excellent customer service. I don't know who wrote that 1 star review, but she need to reevaluate her life

name: Desminique Rowell
text: I rather take the extra mile and go opelika than auburn anyday. The ladies here are very nice except Rebecca. It takes a woman like me to handle her rude ass. My husband had a really bad experience with this woman. The next time we had to come back, I was there with him and I be darned if he had to see her again. She started off wrong...don't I know you from somewhere. I mean where is the hi how r u all today. She was picking then. She got loud with him...Don't raise your voice at me young lady my husband replied. She tried her best to pick an argument with him until I stepped in and straighten her behind out in a nice way, but very sarcastic. Made her feel like a parasite in a nice way😂😂😂😂😂😂. She didn't say a word after that. Turn red and shut the hell up. I bet he want have a problem with her again. U have to stand up to people like her. I mean literally if you didn't want to help, I'm sure there was someone who would have loved to. I just want my tag and that's it. If you don't like your job or if you woke up on the wrong side of the bed....don't bring it in the workforce or leave and I'm sure someone with a nicer attitude who'd love that position.

name: Yvonne Eason
text: I called in and spoke with a lady named Lisa. I said Hi Lisa, I need to check and see how much my tag renewal is going to be.  Her customer service was horrible; she was very rude and condescending.  If there is any possible way that I can I will take my money somewhere else. I guess she does NOT understand who the customer is!

name: william holmes
text: Trash office and trash employees

name: Titus Roberts
text: Slow as always

name: Andrew Platt
text: Please spend my tax dollars on more people. THIS PLACE IS SLOW AF

name: William Harper
text: Receptionist hangs up on phone then when you try to recall she sends you voicemail.This child should be fired.

name: Frankie Stoutemire
text:
This center is under a restoration
and they are looking for volunteers and donations. It’s a place for the whole family
